text: 895236953 | RBH | 94401392 | | 2402140 | 5/16/2004 12:00:00 AM | S/P Rt TKR | | DIS | Admission Date: 6/19/2004 Report Status: Discharge Date: 7/10/2004 ****** DISCHARGE ORDERS ****** BECKER , HAL 446-98-40-2 ID Service: ORT DISCHARGE PATIENT ON: 9/22/04 AT 11:00 AM CONTINGENT UPON Not Applicable WILL D/C ORDER BE USED AS THE D/C SUMMARY: YES Attending: GILFILLAN , RANDOLPH BRIAN , M.D. DISPOSITION: Rehabilitation DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS: TYLENOL ( ACETAMINOPHEN ) 650-1 , 000 MG PO Q6H PRN Pain HOLD IF: Temp >101.5; and notify the HO TYLENOL #3 ( ACETAMINOPHEN W/CODEINE 30MG ) 2 TAB PO Q4-6H Number of Doses Required ( approximate ): 16 ATENOLOL 50 MG PO QD CALCIUM CARBONATE ( 500 MG ELEM. CA++ ) 500 MG PO QD BENADRYL ( DIPHENHYDRAMINE HCL ) 25-50 MG PO HS PRN Insomnia COLACE ( DOCUSATE SODIUM ) 100 MG PO BID FAMOTIDINE 20 MG PO BID FES04 ( FERROUS SULFATE ) 300 MG PO TID X 5 Days FOLATE ( FOLIC ACID ) 1 MG PO QD X 4 Days HCTZ ( HYDROCHLOROTHIAZIDE ) 25 MG PO QD MVI ( MULTIVITAMINS ) 1 TAB PO QD METAMUCIL SUGAR FREE ( PSYLLIUM ( METAMUCIL ) SU... ) 1 PACKET PO QD PRN Instructions: may be given with the patients choice of beverage COUMADIN ( WARFARIN SODIUM ) CHECK W/HO PO QD Starting Today ( 5/25 ) Instructions: Monitor PT/INR & dose for goal INR 2.0-2.5 DVT prophylaxis is planned X 6 weeks Food/Drug Interaction Instruction No high Vitamin-K containing foods Alert overridden: Override added on 5/11/04 by WAID , CHANG PALMER , M.D. SERIOUS INTERACTION: SULFAMETHOXAZOLE & WARFARIN Reason for override: md CHOLECALCIFEROL 400 UNITS PO QD DIET: No Restrictions ACTIVITY: Partial weight-bearing FOLLOW UP APPOINTMENT( S ): Dr Olesky 10/12/04 Xray at 1:15pm Appt at 2:15pm 8/21/04 scheduled , PATC 4/18/04 at 10:20am 5/10/04 scheduled , Arrange INR to be drawn on 10/26/04 with f/u INR's to be drawn every Mon/Thurs days. INR's will be followed by NMC Anticogulation Service No Known Allergies ADMIT DIAGNOSIS: Bilateral Knee OA PRINCIPAL DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS ;Responsible After Study for Causing Admission ) S/P Rt TKR OTHER DIAGNOSIS;Conditions , Infections , Complications , affecting Treatment/Stay Osteoarthritis , LBP S/P Laminectomy , Iron Deficiency Anemia , H/O PE 71/88 OPERATIONS AND PROCEDURES: 5/11/04 POLICAR , AVERY RICARDO , M.D. RIGHT TOTAL KNEE REPLACEMENT OTHER TREATMENTS/PROCEDURES ( NOT IN O.R. ) N/A BRIEF RESUME OF HOSPITAL COURSE: Pt underwent a Rt TKR on 5/29/04 for endstage OA. The patient tolerated the procedure well and had an uncomplicated postoperative course on the TKR pathway. Pt was HD stable but did require transfusion with 2 units of PRBC's on POD 3 for Hct of 27.9. Standard care w/ femoral nerve catheter for acute pain management/CPM , prophylactic Abx until all tubes/drains were d/c'd , and coumadin/TEDS/P-boots for DVT prophylaxis. Wound clean and healing. Pt slow to progress with PT and sustained a fall on the morning of POD 3 when sitting at EOB and slightly confused. Pt had no head trauma or LOC , or extremity injury. Mental status has cleared since that time , but patient still requiring mod assist with functional activities. Pt stable for transfer to rehab on POD 4. ADDITIONAL COMMENTS: DSD qd. The wound may be left OTA when dry. Staples may be removed in rehab or by VNA as of 1/18/04 , please sterristrip the wound. When the patient is discharged home please arrange biweekly blood draws for PT/INR q Mon/Thurs with results called to the WHMH Anticoagulation Service at 915-360-5305. Goal INR is 2.0-2.5. DVT prophylaxis is planned X 6 weeks. Please notify the Anticoagulation Service when the patient is discharged home. DISCHARGE CONDITION: Stable TO DO/PLAN: Arrange biweekly blood draws for PT/INR q Mon/Thurs with results called to 107-568-5779 for outpatient anticoagulation management Notify the Anticoagulation Service when the patient is discharged home Staple removal 1/18/04 Followup w/ Dr Raczak as scheduled No dictated summary ENTERED BY: MENEZ , JEWELL ( MT72 ) 9/22/04 @ 07:15 AM ****** END OF DISCHARGE ORDERS ******
